Capsule comes equipped with a removable waste bag to separate the dirty from clean so your gear stays fresh longer! Hang it in your gym locker or the closet of your hotel room. Once you get back home, open the bag and throw your soiled laundry in the washer.
 




 
External Pocket for All Daily Essentials: The Take Daily Bag's external pockets allow you to easily access your valuables for any daily routine. The bag includes 6 pockets designated for small valuables, shoes, laptop, chargers, water bottle and passport. The side pocket has a smaller internal pocket perfect for keys, cell phone, pen slots and airplane bottles. The main compartment has a clamshell opening to provide maximum access. Stay organized at the airport, gym and work. The Take Daily Bag is meant to be compact so you can easily carry it on the plane and have access to in-flight essentials (medicine, electronics, chargers, and toiletries).    Personal Item Bag Sizing: The Take Daily Bag is 20” x 13” x 8” (50cm x 33cm x 20cm) and fits the definition of a "personal item" for U.S. airlines. The bag perfectly slides under a standard economy seat. 


Don't miss an important deadline. With The Take Daily Bag you can stay connected to the office (whether we want to or not) on the go.


The Take Daily Bag comes in two color options: Blue with Black accents (Orange Interior) & Black with White accents (Royal Blue Interior). 

Each removable bag is used to separate dirty laundry and contain odor. 



As a pharmacist with a love for design, I built upon the idea that medicine capsules help us be better, so why couldn’t a bag do the same? After sketching many initial drafts, I designed Capsule with the same approach a scientist takes when they build a capsule.  
 
I researched and surveyed athletes, travelers, friends and family to discover what most people desire in a bag. Function, versatility and daily use were at the top of the list.  ​

The unique, patent pending design beautifully mimic’s medicine capsules by contrasting ballistic nylon and premium vegan suede. The main durable fabrics are separated by two signature stripes. 


Capsule will be manufactured overseas at a highly skilled and experienced factory. We have been in contact with the manufacturer during the entire Capsule ideation and they have created our "top of production" samples.
Our production schedule has been generated based on idealistic deadlines with the factory. We will try our hardest to ensure that we stay as close to the timeline as possible. Our backers will be notified about delays or when important steps in the production process have been met. 

 

I love daily adventures. From the gym to weekend trips, I try to make my routine exciting. While commuting to work I think a lot about solutions to everyday problems I'd like to improve. I learned quickly that I carry more stuff than I originally thought. Naturally having an entrepreneurial spirit, Capsule was formed. 
I have committed countless hours of research, development, and production to get Capsule where it is now but I can not continue without your support. Your help will be used to fund Capsule's first production run. 
My bag adventure has already proven to be such a rewarding experience and I can not wait for you to make your own Capsule memories.
 - Joey, Founder






With any new company there are certain risks associated. However, I have successfully launched other design projects so you can be confident that Capsule will be a high quality bag.
I am currently working with a professional liaison to mitigate any delays with the factory. They have successfully helped other companies navigate the sometimes difficult world of manufacturing. We have prepared for any challenges during the production process and will keep our backers updated through this entire process to remove any fear or hesitation associated with pledging funds.

story:
Mission:

"Telmer Enterprises is dedicated to providing products that honor your loved one and show your patriotism"

Our goal is to reach all 50 states to fulfill an unmet need in the marketplace for a small flag and solar light kit. This product will allow you to display your patriotism by placing it at a grave site, at home or on an apartment balcony.

This kit includes a US Flag (made in the USA), a solar light with a high capacity battery, a sturdy steel base,and a telescoping flagpole that allows one to adjust the height depending on the application.

Your participation will assist us to purchase the parts that will bring this meaningful product to market at a good value and develop the veterans forum. Our committees will help us develop a business plan that best fits our customer's needs.

Our assembly and shipping will be handled by Productive Alternatives of Fergus Falls, Minnesota.

Like us on Facebook

Our Project: "Shine on U.S.A"


Solar Flag Kit

Our Progress:

This project started when our father passed away May 27, 2011.  He was very patriotic and proud of his country.  To honor his patriotism we decided to fly a flag at his grave site. An all in one kit was not available so we designed our own and would like to offer others the same opportunity.  We resourced manufacturers for all the parts and tested the product for over a year.  Through the testing process we made adjustments in the base (steel) and the light (upgrade panel and battery) to make this product the best product that it can be.

Valley Forge Flag  

Productive Alternatives

We are poised and ready to start production.

Going forward we would like to develop additional patriotic products so that we can cover the various ways that you can show your patriotism. Join us so we can bring these patriotic products to market.

Committees:

1) Forum committee (For others can tell their Veteran story)

2) Territory committee (Develop a strategy to market this product)

3) Development committee (Share your ideas with us)

Tribute:

This project is dedicated to our Father, Duane Telmer Thompson who passed away in 2011.  He served his country in the United States Air Force and was a Korean War Veteran.

DISPLAY YOUR PATRIOTISM!!

Korea

WW-II

 

WW-II

Landscaping

Apartment Balcony

Seasonal

SPECIAL THANKS:

Doug Anderson - Time Lapse Video  

Dan Glaser - Video & Editing (Unmarked Van Films)

David Arkenstone - Time Lapse Music (www.davidarkenstone.com)

Haylee Thompson - Pictures (Rethink Dance Company I Red River Dance)

" SHINE ON USA"

Risks and challenges

Our biggest challenge will be getting the parts ready to package.  There will no doubt be a learning curve but we are up for the challenge. Our Management Team has the experience to get the parts assembled, handle the orders and get your flag kits shipped. If we have a large backer base, we have backup facilities to handle the additional volume but shipping lead times may be extended.

We have the experience and dedication to get the job done right!!


OUR MANAGEMENT TEAM

Gary Thompson: CEO / President 

Self Employed Business Owner     My Project Estimator    &    GreenDoorStorage        Estimating Instructor for the Northwestern Lumber Association

Renee Melby: CFO / Accounting 

Business Manager Ashby Public School
Ashby Education Foundation
Ashby American Legion Auxiliary President

Curt Thompson: CLO / Logistics 

Self Employed Farmer

Sheri Anderson: CMO / Marketing 

Director of Operations at Douglas Scientific 
Former Business Unit Manager for ITW Heartland

Joel Peterson: CPO / Production 

Lodge Manager for Tradition Companies  
Former Production Coordinator (Productive Alternatives)

Telmer Enterprises 
P.O. Box 195 
Ashby, Minnesota 56309

story:
Short summary | The Abel Tasman bag has been around for several years now, travelling all  over the world. This is a special version of this bag, available via Indiegogo only. We are seeking to fund this special bag this way to cover the high minimum order quantity needed to produce this bag. The bag is tested and tried, samples were made, it's ready for production for delivery in February 2021. Hopefully travel restrictions will be gone by then!

About us | We are Amsterdenim, a small, independent Dutch jeans brand. Operating from our denim lab in Amsterdam we develop premium denim goods for the "Gentleman Rebel".

Why Indiegogo? Normally we would produce this bag via our licensee for travel accessories, COVID-19 however forced them out of business. We, as a company, need all our funds for our regular operation and for our core-business which is clothing and mainly denim. 

The "Carolus" floral design is part of our SS21 collection, where we developed a range of items such as t-shirts, longsleeve shirts and hawaii shirts with this print. We had to make a choice to focus on the apparel instead of accessories such as this special piece of luggage.

The Abel Tasman weekender bag in Multicolor.

Via this campaign we are looking to see if there are enough people who would like to get their hands on this unique bag at a special price and help to get it produced and delivered. 

The Abel Tasman traveller in Blue on Blue. 

Travel | Due to COVID-19 there is a lot less travel at present. Despite this situation, we love this bag so much that we feel we must do everything we can to make it. Once we're able to travel again, this bag could make so many heads turn and put a smile on so many faces!


Artwork | The allover print, designed by Marian Van IJzendoorn, combines tulips from Amsterdam and the Indigofera plant, where indigo dye for denim comes from. Available in Multicolor and Blue on Blue "Carolus" print. Carolus is a reference to Carolus Clusius, the botanist who introduced the tulip to the lowlands (The Netherlands and Belgium) in the 1600's.

 

Summary

✔ Heavy duty 14 Oz. canvas bag
✔ Carries up to 40 kilograms
✔ Size: 55x40x30 cm, hand luggage ✈
✔ Satin lining, inside pocket with zip 
✔ Genuine leather straps
✔ Reinforced with "diamond" rivets 
✔ Metal studs on bottom
✔ Detachable leather shoulder strap
✔ Easy acces via one big zipper
✔ Unique and original floral print
✔ Limited edition, only available on Indiegogo!

Early bird Belt

A small token of appreciation for a small group of backers. There are literally only a hand full of these belts (size: 95cm) in each color. Back this campaign for € 10 to receive this unique belt!

Early Bird Abel Tasman Weekender

Get up early and travel in style for a special price! The regular retail price is € 189,99. By offering this bag directly to you, without retailers, we are able to lower the price to € 125. The first 24 backers are rewarded with an extra discount and get this phenomonal bag for just € 99! Available in multicolor or blue. Choose your perk and select which color you want.

Funding goal To produce these bags, the amount needed for the minimum production quantity is € 15.000 Via this campaign we are looking for support, if we manage to raise half the amount needed, € 7.500 we will take these bags in production for delivery in February 2021.

What happens if we don't reach our goal? | This campaign is "all-or-nothing" this means that if we don't reach our minimum goal, we will not receive anything and nobody will be charged anything. In this case we would not produce these bags for now, we would wait for better times and produce them when we can. This could be in 6 months from now, in 2 years or not at all!

The name "Abel Tasman" is a reference the Dutch explorer who discovered Australia (back then "New Holland"), New Zealand (Nieuw Zeeland) and of course Tasmania (still carries his name). In the Dutch language, "tas" means bag. Hence: Abel Tasman for this unique travel bag.


Background | The original or "regular" version of the Abel Tasman canvas weekender bag first came out in 2017. We are proud to see where it has been since then. From Amsterdam to Cape Town, Moscow, Tokyo, New York to Ibiza, Bali and back to Amsterdam. AMS is the international code for Amsterdam Airport, 1275 stands for the official founding year of the city of Amsterdam.

Explore #AMS1275 on instagram to see where Abel Tasman has been around the World.

________________________________________________________________________________________

Credits

Carolus floral design: Marian IJzendoorn @marianvij | Videos: Tim Kasper @tmkspr Eric @superdiksuperdik | Product photos: campaign-store.com Abel Tasman Carryall weekender bag by Amsterdenim www.amsterdenim.com | follow the blue journey @amsterdenim 

________________________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help | We are grateful for any type of support and greatly appreciate your help in making some noise about this campaign. See link sharing tools at the top of this page!

story:
Short Summary

Hello! Introducing new innovative design of portable folding multi-pocket rear seat bag for extra interior storage space inside your car and also works as the safety barrier for your children or pets in the back seat from interfering with your driving while traveling.

Features

(1) Quick and easy to Install or uninstall: Equipped with 4 reliable safety hooks, no need to drill or screw, saving time and effort . Just connect 4 buckle clips on the headrest & bottom of your front driver and passenger seats and you can finish installing in 30 seconds without any tools needed.

(2) Proper covering size: H: 46 cm x 69 cm/18.11x27.17in. The product has good flexibility and adaption that can be applied to vehicle seats of most cars, SUV, and Pick-up.

(3) Made from high quality 600D waterproof Oxford Cloth, light-weight, durable, wear-proof and washable, with a big loading capacity can contain food, tool kits, or anything else you need on your next adventure.

(4) Big Storage capacity: The product has 3 layers, which is better than a single organization bag and can store a lot of more extra items. It also helps to store your items in categories, keep your wallet or handbag at your fingertips, and greatly reduce distracted driving.

We are doing our best to bring our prototype bagbarrier into factory production. Though we do not have any foreseen problems, there is always a chance of roadblocks occurring, which could result in a delay of shipping products to our backers. In the case of an unexpected delay, we will communicate openly with our customers and work hard to fix the issue.

Thank you for your supporting our project.
